intro: Thyrsanthema araneosa, commonly known as the spider-thorn, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its spiny, woody stems and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought and heat. Its unique appearance, with thorn-like structures, provides defense against herbivores. Thyrsanthema araneosa is often found in shrublands and along rocky outcrops.
